description: Israel’s military announced Sunday it is now taking aim at the Lebanon-based Hezbollah’s financial arm and will attack a “large number of targets” in Beirut and elsewhere. Explosions began in Beirut’s southern suburbs about an hour later. Evacuation warnings affected southern Beirut, the eastern Bekaa valley, and parts of southern Lebanon. The Al-Qard al-Hassan, sanctioned […]
title: Israel Says It Will Target Hezbollah’s Financial Arm and Begins Striking Beirut

description: “Deeply shocked” is how diaspora groups describe their reaction to a report that the governing Liberals may suspend regular meetings of a Commons committee dedicated to studying Canada-China relations. “We are deeply shocked by the recent proposal from members of your committee to suspend regular meetings,” said nine Hong Kong community groups in an Oct. […]
title: Suspending China Committee ‘Sends the Wrong Message’ Amid Interference Concerns, Diaspora Groups Say

description: The axis includes terror groups Hamas, Hezbollah, and the Houthis, as well as insurgent militia groups in Iraq, government forces in Syria, and Iran itself.
title: Backed by Iran, ‘Axis of Resistance’ Terror Groups Target Israel

description: Ottawa is unlikely to meet its pledge to cap its deficit at or below $40 billion in the previous fiscal year, as recent estimates by the Parliamentary Budget Officer (PBO) indicate that the federal government falls short of its target by 17 percent. In its Economic and Fiscal Outlook report published Oct. 17, the PBO […]
title: Ottawa Unlikely to Cap Deficit Below $40B as Promised: Budget Watchdog

description: Forecasters expect the Bank of Canada to speed up the pace of interest rate cuts and lower its policy rate by half a percentage point this week. The central bank’s interest rate announcement on Wednesday comes after Statistics Canada reported the annual inflation rate in September tumbled to 1.6 percent — below the Bank of […]
title: With Inflation Below Target, BoC Expected to Deliver Supersized Rate Cut This Week

description: Importers say a new online portal for collecting taxes on goods shipped into Canada is creating headaches ahead of its rollout this week, with potential implications for consumers. On Monday, the federal government’s digital platform for paying duties is set to come online in an effort to streamline the old, paper-based process that customs officials […]
title: Importers Brace for Launch of New Portal to Collect Duties

description: Alleged members of an Indian gang and its leader have been sending shivers down the spines of members of the South Asian diaspora in Canada for years, says a city councillor in Richmond, B.C. Kash Heed said the Bishnoi gang, led by Lawrence Bishnoi, gained notoriety and instilled fear among Indian Canadians well before the […]
title: Bishnoi Gang: Experts Say Fear of Indian Syndicate Has Existed for Years in Canada

description: Israel is expected to retaliate against Iran after it launched hundreds of drones and missiles at Israel earlier this month.
title: US Probes Intelligence Leak Regarding Israel’s Plans to Retaliate Against Iran

description: As aging U.S. residents deal with soaring costs of living, some say retiring in another country is a great option.
title: Inside the Trend of Americans Retiring Abroad

description: HAVANA—Millions of Cubans awoke on Sunday to find their homes still without power after another partial grid failure overnight, deepening a crisis that has raised questions over the viability of the regime’s efforts to reestablish electrical service. The country’s top electricity official, Lazaro Guerra, confirmed a partial grid collapse in the western provinces of Cuba, […]
title: Millions of Cubans Still Without Power as Crisis Deepens

description: The ruling party and opposition in the South Caucuses nation accuse one another of colluding with foreign powers in the run-up to the Oct. 26 election.
title: Key Georgia Election Beset by Rival Claims of Russian, Western Interference

description: Experts raise concerns about staffing shortages, regulatory complexities, funding inadequacies, and the impact of the new 'Support at Home' program.
title: Aged Care Bill May Not Encourage People to Stay Home as Intended, Industry Warns

description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka—A train carrying thousands of gallons of fuel hit a herd of wild elephants in northeast Sri Lanka, killing two of the giant mammals and injuring one other as two of its tankers got derailed, authorities said. The collision happened in the town of Minneriya — about 200 kilometers (124 miles) from the […]
title: Train Hits and Kills 2 Wild Elephants in Sri Lanka as 2 of Its Fuel-Carrying Tankers Derail

description: BANGKOK—The Chinese Consulate in Myanmar’s second-largest city has been slightly damaged by an explosive device, but there were no casualties, the military, independent media and a city resident said Saturday. No public claims of responsibility were made for the attack on Friday in Mandalay. China is a major ally of Myanmar’s military, which came to […]
title: A Small Blast in Myanmar’s Second-Biggest City Damages Chinese Consulate

description: MIAMI—Hurricane Oscar formed Saturday off the coast of the Bahamas, the National Hurricane Center in Miami said. It characterized the storm as “tiny.” The government of the Bahamas has issued a hurricane warning for the Turks and Caicos Islands and the southeastern Bahamas. The government of Cuba has issued a hurricane watch for the provinces […]
title: Hurricane Oscar Forms Off the Bahamas

description: Lack of shipbuilding capacity and Australia's refusal to unquestioningly back the US in regional conflicts are among reasons AUKUS might not happen.
title: Australia May Not Get AUKUS Subs Under Alternative Plan Presented to Congress

description: King Charles and Queen Camilla have made their first public appearance in Australia, greeting devoted well-wishers as they attended a church service. The royal couple was received on Oct. 20 by crowds that wrapped around St Thomas’ Anglican Church in northern Sydney. As the King and Queen made their way to the front entrance, children […]
title: King and Queen All Smiles in First Public Appearance in Australia

description: The centre-right Liberals are yet to concede defeat on Sydney’s northern beaches but admit it will be “extremely difficult” to defeat the teal independent. Former political adviser Jacqui Scruby appears set to become the first “teal” to enter New South Wales (NSW) parliament after a 6 percent swing in the Pittwater by-election on Oct. 19. […]
title: Teal Takes By-election Lead as Liberals Rue Costly Scandals

description: After Canada refused to abide by a ruling over New Zealand dairy imports, the South Pacific nation has invoked a never-before-used dispute resolution.
title: Canada and New Zealand in Historic Trade War Over Dairy
